title: Any superficial Swain trivia you guys at Riot are willing to drop?
body:
I'm just a Swain main starved for the deets. I know we'll likely see him on the PBE around a month from now but I thought I'd fish for whatever info I can anyway.

What's his new hairstyle? Hair colour? Does he still cover his mouth? Is his voice rough like his old one or a bit different? Is his first name still Jericho?

Any answers would be appreciated, and of course if you still can't answer it's cool. If you want to drop something I haven't even asked for that'd be neat too.

Actually, it was in his original "League Judgement."  During the judgement, where the summoners use the champion's memories as a test, Swain sees through the ruse and gets a face to face confrontation.  Afterwards, the following exchange happens:

>High Councilor Kolminye nodded approvingly. “Thank you, and yes – the knowledge exchanged in the bond is private between champion and summoner. You have nothing to fear.”
>
>“Nor do you.” Swain bowed again, keeping his eyes locked on the High Councilor.
>
>A tense pause was broken by the High Councilor. “Why do you want to join the League,**_ Jericho Swain_**?” 

Swain then answers "To become Emperor of Noxus" before adding "I want to kill Jarvan IV."

Side note:  Kinda bums me out that you, a person partially responsible for the creation and maintenance of League's lore, isn't aware of that.  Then again, the collective lack of knowledge of lore history might explain recent changes.

Ah, I think I read the Judgment but didn't realize that was the first mention. When referencing things on the wiki, it's difficult to place them in time and we don't have internal tools that help us do that (yet). We use the player wiki too. We're trying to get better though because you're right, this stuff matters.

Yeah.  That was common at the time.  Still is, if I'm totally honest.  

> When referencing things on the wiki, it's difficult to place them in time...

My best solution is to go into the "History" tab and go "1st," then "League Judgement (if there is one)," then "2nd," and the current lore in the "biography" tab.

> ...and we don't have internal tools that help us do that (yet). We use the player wiki too. 

Well, Riot did have those tools available to them years ago.  Then a previous Narrative Lead (not 100% sure which one) decided those stories weren't necessary anymore (sometime in 2013) and a Website Lead later removed access to all of them from the website for some unfathomable reason.

> We're trying to get better though because you're right, this stuff matters.

Sounds like you guys need an official historian of League's lore.  You also might need a direct advocate for players and not go strictly by the "but we're players too" mantra.  ;)

But honestly what's the point when the old lore isn't canon anymore? It's useful to go back to and use and update what stuff works but do we really need to know exactly when swains name was mentioned in a non Canon story?

If this stuff matters let me give you a little info.

Swain was based on a demonic Tzeench Chaos Lord from warhammer, extremely fucking cool lore, and they are said to be omniscient, always perfectly ahead in all matters of war/tactics/everything, whilst commanding god like levels of magic.

Go look em up.

Simply put, making him a vastaya downgrades him to a god-like, omniscient, immortal being to a little shitty druid nature mage.

If you truly insist on making him a vastaya instead of a demon, you could say Raven Vastaya are nigh non-existent and are connected to some demonic chaos realm, then swain can have the best of both worlds, his old lore as a demon and new as part vastaya.

That lack of knowledge you are referencing may be on purpose. If someone who reads every document on something is going to start writing about it, they are biased by the information they have. If Riot's lore team is wanting fresh innovation with the lore, having fresh slates will allow for better stories that aren't trying to be reigned in by the past.
We also have Sarah **Fortune** and Shauna **Vayne** who go by their surname in game.

Actually in some ways, Noxus seems far freer than Demacia.

This is most definitely true.

In Demacia, it's probably got a strict social hierarchy, so if you're a peasant you can't do much but serve as a foot soldier. Also, Demacia is a very Knight Templar-ish nation and hates magic, and so will persecute anyone who uses it on the spot. However, they do have good morals for the most part and don't care about expansion.

Noxus, on the other hand, allows the use of magic freely. Anyone with the strength or skill can rise up to power given the right circumstances. It's much more individually free as well: even though the armies are big swaths of people, regular foot soldiers can often be recognized (see Riven). However, Noxus is a massive and still-expanding expansionist state, and least some of their rulers want to Take Over The World.

You don't think Riven was a rank-and-file, do you? 
because she was the commander of her troops and had at least as much power to decide whether or not an Ionian child could be held prisoner, sent home with a warning, or murdered on the spot. (Hint: She chose to have two of her soldiers cut the kid's head off.) 

It's almost like Riven is a horrible person and deserves worse than what she got, rather than a victim of circumstance or betrayed by her country. She's not even mad about Noxus's crimes against humanity. She's mad they used Zaun machines to win a losing battle.

What I meant by "regular soldiers can be recognized" is that Riven was never of a particularly high social class, but she still became a great warrior and leader for the Noxian troops (great as in quality, not morality). Most of the high-ranking Demacian soldiers, on the other hand, are nobles or high in the social class; the only one I can think of otherwise is Quinn, and even then she's more of a scout.

And, yeah, Riven's not a good person. But she doesn't go the extra mile to be a monster like some of the villains in League.
